articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves to Attend 68th UN Session
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves to Attend 68th UN Session
Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation headed by Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, left here by air on Saturday to attend the 68th session of the UN General Assembly.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea headed by its Vice-Chairman Kil Sang Bong left here today to visit China.
					 Foreign delegations arrived here on the same day to participate in the 9th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair.
					
					 They included delegations of Germany, Singapore and Turkey.
					
					 Arriving here earlier were delegations of Russia, Italy, China and Cuba.

articles.title: Greetings to Armenian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a George Abela
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 21 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Malta, George Abela, con motivo del dia de independencia de ese pais.
					Convencido de que las largas relaciones de amistad entre la RPDC y Malta seguiran ampliandose y desarrollandose conforme a los intereses y deseos comunes de ambos pueblos, el remitente le desea al destinatario exitos en su trabajo para la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Greetings to Maltese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Maltese President
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greeting to George Abela, president of Malta, on the occasion of its independence day.
					 The message expressed belief that the long-standing friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in keeping with the common interests and desire of the two peoples, wishing the Maltese president success in his work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Congratulations to Albanian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Albanian Prime Minister
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, on Friday sent a congratulatory message to Edi Rama upon his appointment as prime minister of Albania.
					 The message expressed belief that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger as required by the new century, wishing the prime minister of Albania success in his responsible work for the development and prosperity of the country. 
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun on the same day sent a similar message to Ditmir Bushati upon his appointment as foreign minister of Albania.

articles.title: Greetings to Nicaraguan Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Nicaraguan Foreign Minister
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a message of greeting to Samuel Santos Lopez, minister of Foreign Affairs of Nicaragua, on September 15 on the occasion of the 192nd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields thanks to common efforts, wishing the foreign minister of Nicaragua success in his work and Nicaragua development and prosperity.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il by Delegation of World Council of Churches
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il by Delegation of World Council of Churches
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the World Council of Churches led by General Secretary Olav Fykse Tveit visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Saturday.
					 The delegation laid bouquets before the statues in deep reverence and paid tribute to them.
					
					 It arrived here that day.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Feats for Nation Building
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Feats for Nation Building
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The proud history of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is associated with the great exploits of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
					 After Korea's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule, she visited different parts of the country to encourage people from all walks of life in building new Korea.
					
					 At the various meetings with popular masses, including round-table talks organized by the Chongjin City People's Committee in December Juche 34 (1945), she told them about President Kim Il Sung's exploits for Korea's  liberation and his idea on nation building. And she saw to it that urgent problems arising in building a new country and people's demands were reported to the President.
					
					 Under her deep care, revolutionary literary and art works and publications were created or issued to make the whole country seethe with patriotic zeal. They include "Song of General Kim Il Sung", an immortal revolutionary hymn carrying the people's deep reverence for the President, and the first drama in liberated Korea "Mt. Paektu" and feature film "My Home Village".
					
					 Kim Jong Suk made big efforts to building a Juche-based regular army. 
					
					 She visited Pyongyang Institute, a military academy, more than 30 times and personally conducted trial firing of the first home-made submachine gun.
					
					 In the days when such democratic reforms were enforced as the agrarian reform, the nationalization of major industries and the law on sex equality, she always went among workers, peasants and women to call upon them to work innovations in production as the masters of the country.
					
					 In 1947 alone, she visited many industrial establishments, including the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory and the Pyongyang Silk Mill (at that time), to inspire the workers to the general ideological mobilization movement for nation building and the emulation drive for increased production.
					
					 She also worked heart and soul to ensure the training of national cadres and lay a solid foundation for the nation's educational development. She raised the pencil problem to the President in time so that it could be discussed at the First Session of the Provisional People's Committee of North Korea. And her devoted efforts were associated with the foundation of Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk's great feats for the building of a new country and prosperity of the DPRK will remain forever in the history of the nation.

articles.title: DPRK Wrestler Bags Gold Medal in World Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Wrestler Bags Gold Medal in World Championships
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK wrestler Yun Won Chol bagged a gold medal in the men's 55kg Greco-Roman category of the 2013 World Wrestling Championships. 
					 He beat back his Croatian and German rivals. In the quarter-finals he trounced Hungarian wrestler. In the semi-finals he won a sweeping victory over his Russian rival before the passage of six minutes by his overwhelming technical and tactical edge. 
					
					 On Friday he humbled his south Korean rival in the finals. 
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK wrestler So Sim Hyang won a bronze medal in the women's 51kg freestyle category.

articles.title: Coal Output on Increase in DPRK
articles.content:
Coal Output on Increase in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The coal production is increasing in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 According to data available at the Ministry of Coal Industry, tunneling speed and coal output increased by 3 percent and 5 percent respectively until mid-September this year as compared with the same period of last year.
					
					 Hundreds of preparatory cutting faces have been secured throughout the country.
					
					 The Tokchon Area Coal-mining Complex carried out the coal turnout at 111 percent.
					
					 Toksong and other coal mines in Tokchon area raised their production by 16 percent with introduction of rapid tunneling and rational blasting methods.
					
					 The February 8 Jikdong Youth Coal Mine under the Sunchon Area Youth Coal Mining Complex swelled the coal yield at 109 percent, keeping mining equipment at full-capacity operation.
					
					 Similar achievements were also reported from coal mines in northern part of the country. The Soksong Coal Mine under the Myongchon Area Coal-mining Complex turned out a large quantity of coal needed for the chemical industry.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Lambasted for Abusing Dialogue and Negotiations for Pursuing Confrontation: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Lambasted for Abusing Dialogue and Negotiations for Pursuing Confrontation: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The situation on the Korean Peninsula is reaching the phase of detente and the inter-Korean relations are inching close to reconciliation and cooperation. But there are forces throwing obstacles in this way.
					 Recently the chief executive of south Korea and other high-ranking politicians vied with each other to bluster that the atmosphere of reconciliation created thanks to the DPRK's sincere proposal for dialogue and positive efforts is ascribable to "their pulling" and it is the fruition of their "principled policy toward the north." They termed the tour of Mt. Kumgang a source of "money-making" by the north and went the lengths of describing the international games hosted by it according to practice and rules as a "change," a silly story. 
					
					 This is nothing but an unbearable mockery and provocation to the DPRK which has shown magnanimity and sincerity to realize the desire of the fellow countrymen despite all sorts of difficulties.
					
					 It is worth recalling how the situation on the Korean Peninsula has been put on the orbit of detente though it had been driven into an extreme phase.
					
					 Who has made sincere efforts to settle in a broad-minded manner such issues as putting the shuttered Kaesong Industrial Zone on the orbit of regular operation and realizing the reunion of separated families and their relatives, a tragedy resulting from the nation's division, and resuming the tour of Mt. Kumgang which had been suspended.
					
					 As a matter of fact, the DPRK has so far overlooked even the confrontation racket kicked up by the south Korean conservative group for the sake of national reconciliation and development of inter-Korean relations, though it is something unpardonable in the light of common sense. 
					
					 This being a hard reality, the south Korean puppet regime is rattling the nerves of the DPRK, dialogue partner, by kicking up such extreme rackets for confrontation as totally denying its social system, misinterpreting its good faith and magnanimity.
					
					 It is busy with north-targeted war maneuvers and arms buildup, vociferating about "unification under liberal democracy" behind the scene of dialogue and "striking the north by crossing the Military Demarcation Line" in league with its American master. 
					
					 It is staging such "witch-hunt campaign" as cracking down on all pro-democracy figures who call for inter-Korean reconciliation, unity and reunification, branding them as "pro-communist elements" and "those following the north" after deliberately linking the "case of attempted rebellion" with the north. 
					
					 Dialogue and negotiations have taken place between the north and the south under such situation, a fruition of the DPRK's patient efforts.
					
					 However, the south Korean puppet regime is trumpeting that progress made in the inter-Korean relations is ascribable to its "theory of principle" and rattling the nerves of the DPRK, its dialogue partner. This is a revelation of its ulterior design to escalate confrontation with the latter. And this cannot be construed otherwise than behaviors of hooligans bereft of even elementary human ethics.
					
					 The conservative group's trumpeting about reconciliation and confidence-building is no more than an empty talk to deceive the world public and the compatriots. Its ulterior purpose is to incite confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 It is none other than the conservative group which talks about dialogue in public but orchestrates an alarming scenario of confrontation behind the scene.
					
					 Is it possible to have normal dialogue and discuss the issue of mending the inter-Korean relations with those brandishing daggers before their dialogue partner?
					
					 It is as clear as a pikestaff that no issue can be properly settled under the prevailing situation where the conservative group abuses dialogue and negotiations as a lever for inciting confrontation, regarding the north-south relations as those between foes.
					
					 If "confrontation accompanied by dialogue" remains a principle of the group, one should not expect any elementary progress in the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group is wholly to blame for the prevailing situation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Praises Ideological, Theoretical Exploits of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Praises Ideological, Theoretical Exploits of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il were peerlessly outstanding thinkers and theoreticians produced by the 20th century. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in an article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung had a deep insight into the requirements of the times when popular masses were emerging as masters of the world, masters of their own destinies early in the 20th century. He clarified the philosophical principle centered on the people through his rare ideological and theoretical activities and explored a new way of the Juche revolution. 
					
					 The Juche idea founded by him brought about a new phase for the development of human thought and definitely turned the trend of history into the struggle for the independence of the popular masses. 
					
					 In the whole period of the revolutionary leadership Kim Jong Il clarified the new principles and contents through his tireless ideological and theoretical activities, enriching the treasure house of the Juche idea and remarkably increasing the attractive power and vitality of Kimilsungism. 
					
					 He formulated and systematized the Songun idea as guidelines of the Korean revolution, carrying forward the President's idea of attaching importance to arms and military affairs. This was a historic event to be specially recorded in the history of human thought. 
					
					 Now the army and people of the DPRK extend the highest glory and deepest thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un, who formulated the revolutionary idea of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, adding eternal shine to it. 
					
					 The august images, names and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are now shedding rays all over the world and an immensely rosy future is unfolding for the country and the nation thanks to Kim Jong Un, who is leading the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Giving Priority to Nation in Reunification Issue
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Giving Priority to Nation in Reunification Issue
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- In order to improve the inter-Korean relations it is important to achieve national unity, while giving priority and attaching importance to the nation, says Rodong Sinmun in an article Saturday.
					 The stand of giving priority and attaching importance to the nation and achieving national unity is the standpoint and attitude to settle the issue of the nation by the efforts of its own driving force, while valuing its independent demand and interest before anything else, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 To firmly maintain and apply such stand is a key to easing the confrontation between the north and the south and achieving reunification and prosperity.
					
					 The only way out for the nation is to push forward the cause of national reunification, while getting reconciled and united with the fellow countrymen, not antagonizing them and inciting confrontation with them.
					
					 It is necessary to maintain the stand that the Korean nation is the best and there is nothing impossible when it pools its efforts. Herein lies the way of repelling the obstructions of foreign forces and opening up a bright avenue for national reunification and prosperity.
					
					 The June 15 era of reunification when the Korean nation brought about signal successes in the movement for national reunification, ending the history of inter-Korean confrontation, proves the truth that independent reunification, peace and prosperity can be achieved if the Korean nation achieves reconciliation and unity while mending the inter-Korean relations by itself.
					
					 There is no doubt that when the north and the south pool their minds and intentions out of the stand of giving priority and attaching importance to the nation and achieving national unity, the inter-Korean relations will fundamentally improve and the basic issue for national reunification and prosperity will be settled.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts Japan's Bid for Permanent Seat at UNSC
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts Japan's Bid for Permanent Seat at UNSC
Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- New Japanese Ambassador to the United Nations Motohide Yoshikawa in a recent press conference said that the reform of the UN Security Council is "his lifelong duty" and Japan should "display its leadership ability" in the reform of the UNSC in a renewed bid to achieve its goal to permanently sit on the UN Security Council.
					Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					This is a cock-and-bull-story of those who do not know where they stand.
					
					Japan is not qualified to eye a permanent membership of the UNSC.
					
					No country can match Japan in servile diplomacy.
					
					Whenever a crucial event takes place in the international arena, Japan has never maintained its independent viewpoint. Japan is the worst country acting under pulls and pressures of the U.S.
					
					Japan committed hideous crimes against humanity in the past and has persistently denied and distorted its past wrongdoings.
					
					Japan has harbored the dream of overseas aggression, not for peace.
					
					It is rushing headlong into the moves for turning itself into a military power and launching overseas aggression, frantically instilling militarism into the minds of the people, stepping up arms buildup, expanding the overseas military operations of the "Self-Defense Forces" and working hard to revise "the Pacifist Constitution."
					
					It is clear that Japan will launch its overseas aggression with increased frenzy if it sits on the UNSC.
					
					Japan would be well advised to break with its crime-woven past and win international confidence before making a bid for such seat.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Slammed for Abusing Inter-Korean Dialogue for Pursuing Confrontation
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Slammed for Abusing Inter-Korean Dialogue for Pursuing Confrontation
Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea issued on Saturday the following statement: 
					Thanks to the DPRK's sincere proposals for dialogue and its positive efforts, the situation on the Korean Peninsula, which had reached an extreme phase, has been put on the orbit of detente and the north-south relations are improving.
					
					However, such hard-won inter-Korean ties are again inching close to a serious crisis due to the reckless and vicious confrontation racket of the south Korean conservative group.
					
					It describes a series of successes registered in the north-south relations recently as a fruition of its "theory of principle", claiming that it is "the result of confidence-building process on the Korean Peninsula", and "the principled policy towards the north" is "pulling" the DPRK.
					
					It slandered the tour of Mt. Kumgang, an undertaking common to the nation, as a "source of money making" by the north. In reference to the international games hosted by the north according to practice and rules, it is foolishly trumpeting about "change" and the like. 
					
					This is the height of the practice of a guilty party filing the suit first. It is an unpardonable mockery and insult to the good faith, magnanimity and sincere efforts of the DPRK.
					
					Dialogue and negotiations are taking place between the north and the south despite the extreme confrontation racket of totally negating the social system in the DPRK now under way in south Korea. This is entirely ascribable to the invariable efforts of the DPRK to implement the north-south joint declaration.
					
					Nevertheless, the group describes the progress made in the inter-Korean ties thanks to the sincere efforts of the DPRK as the fruition of their "theory of principle". This is shameless and gangster-like behavior.
					
					The south Korean regime is now busy with war drills and arms build-up against compatriots in league with its American master, crying out for achieving "unification under liberal democracy" behind the scene of dialogue.
					
					It is frantically staging an alarming "witch-hunting campaign" aimed at cracking down upon all progressive democrats, who call for reconciliation and unity and reunification between the north and the south, by branding them as "pro-communist elements" and "forces following the north" on absurd charges that the "case of plotted rebellion" is linked with the north.
					
					It is hard to expect any normal dialogue and the development of the inter-Korean ties in such terror-ridden atmosphere in which even the hard-won inter-Korean dialogue is being abused by the group for confrontation with compatriots and it is going mad with war drills against the north  and repressive racket.
					
					The Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) clarifies the following stance as regards the prevailing grave situation:
					
					1. The DPRK puts on hold the reunion of separated families and relatives from the north and the south scheduled to take place between the north and the south till a normal atmosphere is created for dialogue and negotiations.
					
					It is impossible to properly settle any elementary humanitarian issue but only a vicious cycle of confrontation will repeat itself as long as the south Korean conservative regime is abusing all dialogues and negotiations as means for confrontation, regarding the north-south relations as hostile ties.
					
					The DPRK declares that the talks on resuming the tour of Mt. Kumgang will be postponed, too, which the south Korean puppet regime uses as a lever for smear campaign against the DPRK and regards as a means for confrontation.
					
					2. The DPRK will take strong and decisive counteractions against the south Korean puppet regime's ever-escalating war provocations to it.
					
					Dialogue can never go together with war.
					
					It is sadly mistaken if it thinks the bad habit dating back to the era of dictatorship when traitors trumpeted about "confrontation accompanied with dialogue" would work even today.
					
					The DPRK will never allow any slight attempt at provocation on the part of the south Korean warmongers but take a strong counteraction against it.
					
					3. The DPRK will never remain a passive onlooker to the conspiratorial moves against the DPRK and all sorts of suppression of the pro-reunification patriots being perpetrated under the pretext of linkage to it.
					
					Such vicious anti-DPRK conspiratorial moves and the harsh suppression of those pro-reunification patriots in south Korea only bring to light the true colors of the conservative group as confrontation maniacs as they are a revelation of extreme hostility towards compatriots. 
					
					The fascist action of the group to eliminate all those who call for reconciliation and unity with compatriots is nothing but an ulterior intention to pursue confrontation with the DPRK to the last.
					
					The south Korean conservative regime is wholly to blame for the prevailing situation as it abuses dialogue for pursuing confrontation.
					
					The DPRK will do its best for the development of the inter-Korean ties and peace and prosperity but it has no idea of showing good faith and magnanimity even for those keen to pursue confrontation with it to the last.
					
					The DPRK will closely watch the future developments in south Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Sends Open Questionnaire to Chief Executive
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Sends Open Questionnaire to Chief Executive
Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea sent an open questionnaire to the puppet chief executive on September 16.
					The questionnaire branded Park Chung-Hee as a typical pro-Japanese element and traitor to the nation as he took the lead in punitive operations against participants in the independence movement, serving the Japanese imperialists in the past.
					
					It went on:
					
					Park trampled down the spirit of the April 19 popular uprising by staging the May 16 military coup and suppressed the pro-democracy movement with military dictatorship. It is illegal and anachronistic reckless remarks for the present chief executive to have said she "got the greatest influence" from such pro-Japanese dictator.
					
					Noting that the "Security Law" (SL) is a typical law against democracy as it violates the freedom of thinking, political view, assembly and association, it denounced the authorities for trampling down the basic rights of the people.
					
					The questionnaire branded Kim Kwan Jin, minister of Defence, and Nam Jae Jun, director of the Intelligence Service (IS), as the arch criminals blocking peaceful reunification with warlike demeanors agitating a preemptive attack and war against the north and throwing the society into great mayhem by fabricating false cases.
					
					It noted that the people can never pardon Lee Myung Bak and his elder brother Lee Sang Duk for such acts of treachery as giving up sovereignty to meet the interests of the U.S. and Japan, fooling and deceiving the people and faithfully serving foreign forces.
					
					Urging the chief executive to break with the pro-Japanese dictator, abolish the SL, oust Kim Kwan Jin and Nam Jae Jun from their offices and punish Lee and his brother, the questionnaire demanded her clarify her stand on those issues.

articles.title: Japan's Denial of Sexual Slavery under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japan's Denial of Sexual Slavery under Fire in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea held the 1092nd Wednesday rally outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul in protest against the Japanese authorities' distortion of history. 
					 Speakers at the rally recalled that the part dealing with the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army of the history textbooks which passed the screening in Japan is quite contrary to facts. 
					
					 They held that such history textbooks in which the sexual slavery is misrepresented or deleted should not be allowed to go into the hands of students. 
					
					 They urged the Japanese authorities to make a sincere apology for the past crimes, record the crimes against humanity in the history textbooks and make sure that true history is taught to the students.

articles.title: Foreign Party Delegations, Delegates Support Just Cause of Korean People
articles.content:
Foreign Party Delegations, Delegates Support Just Cause of Korean People
Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- A joint statement was issued in support of the just cause of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the people of the DPRK on Sept. 8 at a meeting of foreign party delegations and delegates, members of the leadership of the Communist Party of Portugal and the delegation of officials of the WPK who participated in the 37th festival of Avante, the organ of the Communist Party of Portugal.
					The statement extended support to the WPK and the people of the DPRK in their efforts for the peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					It said thanks to the unshakable stand and sincere efforts of the WPK and the Korean people to achieve peace and stability of the peninsula and realize national reconciliation and unity, the inter-Korean ties that had faced the extreme confrontation and the danger of war have reached the phase of dialogue and negotiations.
					
					It noted that an agreement on restarting operations at Kaesong Industrial Zone was adopted between the north and the south of Korea, and the work to realize the reunion of separated families and relatives is making progress, an event encouraging the progressives of the world.
					
					It expressed full support for the Korean people in their efforts to achieve the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and reunify the country, condemning the U.S. policy of stifling the DPRK.
					
					Being convinced that the peace-loving stand and efforts of the WPK and the Korean people will greatly contribute to the peace in the world, it expressed full solidarity with them.

articles.title: Foreign Media Praise DPRK
articles.content:
Foreign Media Praise DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign media reported about the DPRK from Sept. 5 to 7 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 A Vietnamese Internet news service under the title of "Real Life of DPRK" carried a photo of statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, photos of Marshal Kim Jong Un and those showing the development of the DPRK and the happy life of its people.
					
					 The Thai paper Xing San Daily devoted its one whole page to an article titled "65 Years Characterized by Victory and Glory" praising the undying nation-building feats of the peerlessly great men, illustrated with a portrait of the smiling President.
					
					 The Hungarian paper Liberation carried a photo of Kim Jong Un standing on the tribune of honor, waving back to the enthusiastically cheering masses at the military parade and mass demonstration of Pyongyang citizens marking the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. It also carried an article illustrated with photos of service persons and people taking part in the event.
					
					 The Ethiopian paper Reporter carried articles titled "Brilliant Succession to Revolutionary Cause of Juche" and "Invincibility of WPK Which Will Steadily Grow Strong" with a photo of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The paper said as Kim Jong Un is possessed of rare leadership ability and foresightedness, the future of the DPRK is immensely rosy and bright.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Talk Carried by Pakistani Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Talk Carried by Pakistani Paper
Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The Pakistani paper Patriot on September 15 carried the detailed gist of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's talk "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution."  The talk was published in Rodong Sinmun, organ of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Joson Inmingun, organ of the Korean People's Army, on the Day of Songun.
					The talk, made public on August 25, Juche 102 (2013), deals with the Songun revolutionary feats of leader Kim Jong Il and clarifies the essence and originality of the idea of the Songun revolution and the tasks to be carried out to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Talk Lauded by Juche Idea Followers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Talk Lauded by Juche Idea Followers
Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Lyudmil Kostadinov, chief of the Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, issued a statement on September 10 supporting supreme leader Kim Jong Un's talk "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution".
					The talk was published in Rodong Sinmun, organ of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Joson Inmingun, organ of the Korean People's Army, on the Day of Songun.
					
					The chief noted:
					
					Kim Jong Un clarified in the talk the steadfast will of the party, army and people of the DPRK to successfully carry out the revolutionary cause of Juche, invariably holding high the banner of Songun.
					
					We, the followers of the Juche idea, were greatly moved to receive Kim Jong Un's talk and are full of confidence.
					
					We extend full support to the idea and line set forth by Kim Jong Un.
					
					We will intensify the study of the Juche idea and the idea of Songun revolution and actively disseminate them.
					
					Only victory is in store for the Korean people who are working hard to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the national reunification under the uplifted banner of Songun, true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK Introduced by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
DPRK Introduced by Foreign Papers
Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried articles on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					The Romanian paper Romania Muncitoare in its September issue carried an article titled "DPRK Today."
					
					The DPRK with a long history spanning five thousand years and excellent cultural tradition is ushering in a heyday of development, the paper said, adding:
					
					The DPRK is an independent country. It has an invincible military strength.
					
					It has powerful national defence industry capable of making at will any ultra-modern weapons for both attack and defense.
					
					The DPRK's economy is rapidly developing despite severe situation and environment.
					
					The foundation of the self-supporting national economy has been steadily cemented as required by the industrial revolution in the new century.
					
					The Zimbabwean newspaper Herald on Sep. 7 carried an article under the title of "DPRK Accelerating the Building of an Economic Power" which said the DPRK is giving priority to the living of the people even though it suffers from shortage of everything.
					
					Slogan "Everything for the people and everything relying on masses!" is being held high and desire and demand of the people are reflected even in a building, it added.
					
					The Syrian papers Al Thawrah and Al Baath and the Bangladeshi paper Bangladesh Today on Sep. 8 and 9 carried articles under the titles "Independence and Achievement" and "To Eminence of a Thriving Nation."
					
					The papers introduced the shining history of victory of the DPRK, stressing the Korean people will win the final victory for the building of a thriving nation before long.

articles.title: CRPP denuncia a conservadores surcoreanos por emplear dialogo N-S en campana de enfrentamiento
articles.content:
CRPP denuncia a conservadores surcoreanos por emplear dialogo N-S en campana de enfrentamiento
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) hizo publica el dia 21 la siguiente declaracion: 
					Hoy dia, gracias a la sincera propuesta de dialogo y los esfuerzos activos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, entra en el proceso de relajamiento la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana, que se acercaba a la fase extremada, y se van mejorando las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas. 
					
					No obstante, tales vinculos intercoreanos, dificilmente preparados, vuelven a la crisis intolerable debido a la imprudente y brutal campana conflictiva de los conservadores surcoreanos. 
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos hablan tanto como si algunos exitos, que se alcanzan ultimamente en las relaciones N-S, fueran frutos de su "doctrina de mantenimiento de principios". Especificamente, dicen que son "resultados del proceso de confianza de la Peninsula Coreana" y esta "atrayendo" a alguien "su politica de principios sobre el Norte". 
					
					En cuanto al turismo al monte Kumgang, proyecto comun de la nacion, lo califican de "fuente de ingreso" de alguien. 
					
					Ademas, hablan de algun "cambio" de la RPDC aduciendo una competencia deportiva internacional que auspicio ella segun las costumbres y reglas internacionales. 
					
					Esa conducta de bandido es una burla e insulto intolerables a la buena fe, la magnanimidad y los sinceros esfuerzos de la RPDC. 
					
					Aunque en la sociedad surcoreana se arma diariamente la extremada campana conflictiva que niega totalmente el sistema social y regimen de la RPDC, se abrieron el dialogo y negociaciones entre ambas partes coreanas, gracias a los invariables esfuerzos de la parte Norte por ejecutar la Declaracion Conjunta N-S.
					
					Sin embargo, los titeres surcoreanos anuncian cinicamente tal avance de relaciones intercoreanas como resultado de su "doctrina de mantenimiento de principios". 
					
					Ahora, detras de la cortina de dialogo, se entregan con frenesi en confabulacion con su amo norteamericano a los ejercicios belicos y al aumento armamentista contra la parte connacional insistiendo en la "unificacion bajo el sistema democratico y liberal".
					
					En particular, vinculando injustamente con la RPDC el "caso de conspiracion para rebelion", libran la "caza de brujas" contra todas las personalidades progresistas y democraticas, que demandan la reconciliacion y unidad Norte-Sur y la reunificacion de la patria, calificandolas de "fuerzas pro-Norte y procomunistas". 
					
					Bajo tales circunstancias espeluznantes en que se malemplea en la confrontacion fratricida hasta el dialogo Norte-Sur y se lanza la campana de guerra y de represion contra la RPDC, no se puede esperar el dialogo normal ni el desarrollo de relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Dada la grave situacion, el Comite por la Reunificacion de la Patria expone la siguiente posicion: 
					
					1. Aplazaremos el encuentro de familiares y parientes separados en el Norte y el Sur, programado para fechas inmediatas, hasta que se prepare el ambiente normal para el dialogo y las negociaciones.
					
					Mientras la banda de conservadores surcoreanos malemplea como ahora los dialogos y negociaciones de todo tipo como medios de enfrentamiento considerando las relaciones intercoreanas como las hostiles, no se puede resolver correctamente ni el elemental problema humanitario y se repetira solo el circulo vicioso de enfrentamiento.
					
					Igualmente, declaramos la posposicion de las conversaciones para reanudar el turismo al monte Kumgang, otro tema usado por los titeres surcoreanos como medio de calumnia y enfrentamiento con la RPDC.
					
					2. Tomaremos contramedidas rotundas y decisivas a las cada dia mas crecientes maniobras de los titeres surcoreanos para provocar la guerra contra la RPDC.
					
					No seran compatibles nunca el dialogo y la guerra.
					
					Estarian muy equivocados si ellos piensan que podran salir con la suya con el vicio de la epoca de dictadura del pasado en que se preconizaba la "confrontacion con dialogo".
					
					Tomaremos fuertes contramedidas a cualquier minimo intento provocativo de los belicistas surcoreanos.
					
					3. No estaremos con brazos cruzados ante el complot anti-RPDC y la campana de represion feroz de toda indole contra las personalidades patrioticas pro-reunificacion.
					
					Esas practicas son una expresion coherente de la hostilidad extremada a la parte connacional y demuestran a todo el mundo la naturaleza conflictiva de la banda titere surcoreana.
					
					La conducta fascista de los conservadores surcoreanos deseosos de acabar con todos los hombres, que abogan por reconciliarse y unirse con los connacionales, significa la intencion de enfrentarse hasta el final con la RPDC.
					
					Toda la responsabilidad de la situacion dada recae sobre ellos que malemplean el lugar de dialogo como escenario de enfrentamiento.
					
					Nos esforzaremos en todo lo posible por el desarrollo de las relaciones Norte-Sur, la paz y la prosperidad, pero no tenemos ninguna intencion de tratar con buena fe y magnanimidad hasta a los que quieren enfrentarse hasta el final.
					
					Observaremos atentamente la situacion posterior del Sur de Corea.

articles.title: Parte de Pyongyang delegacion de la RPDC para asamblea general de la ONU
articles.content:
Parte de Pyongyang delegacion de la RPDC para asamblea general de la ONU
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea encabezada por el vicecanciller Pak Kil Yon, partio el dia 21 por via aerea de esta capital para tomar parte en el 68o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a George Abela
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a George Abela
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 21 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Malta, George Abela, con motivo del dia de independencia de ese pais.
					Convencido de que las largas relaciones de amistad entre la RPDC y Malta seguiran ampliandose y desarrollandose conforme a los intereses y deseos comunes de ambos pueblos, el remitente le desea al destinatario exitos en su trabajo para la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a Serge Sarkissian
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a Serge Sarkissian
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 21 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Armenia, Serge Sarkissian, con motivo del dia nacional de ese pais.
					En su misiva, el remitente expresa la esperanza de que los lazos de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y Armenia se desarrollen positivamente conforme al deseo e intereses comunes de los dos pueblos.
					
					Desea al destinatario y a su pueblo los exitos en sus labores para la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju envia mensaje de felicitacion al nuevo premier de Albania
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju envia mensaje de felicitacion al nuevo premier de Albania
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea Pak Pong Ju envio el dia 20 un mensaje de felicitacion al premier de la Republica de Albania, Edi Rama, con motivo de su nombramiento a ese cargo.
					La misiva expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion de larga historia entre los dos paises se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas conforme a la demanda del nuevo siglo, y le desea exitos en las responsabilidades para el desarrollo y la prosperidad del pais.
					
					El mismo dia, el canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun hizo lo mismo a su nuevo par de Albania Ditmir Bushati.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun felicita a su homólogo nicaragüense
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun felicita a su homólogo nicaragüense
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El canciller de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, Pak Ui Chun, envió el día 15 un mensaje de felicitación a su homólogo nicaragüense Samuel Santos López con motivo de 192º aniversario de la independencia del país latinoamericano.
					Expresando la convicción de que las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperación entre los dos países se ampliarán y se desarrollarán en varios sectores gracias a los esfuerzos conjuntos, el remitente formuló votos por los éxitos en el trabajo del destinatario y por el desarrollo y la prosperidad de Nicaragua.
